result.execSummary:
The defendant Whitney L Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10/21/16 Probation is extended for 1 yr from 11/19/16 to 11/19/17, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $253  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AB.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

records.addlTxt: and Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing -  Probation is extended for 1 yr from 11/19/16 to 11/19/17, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.  Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.

Defendant appeared.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Whitney L Thomas in court. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for State of Wisconsin. Probation agent Alyssa Burke also present in court. Hearing requested by agent.  Agent is requesting to extend probation to allow for payment of restitution. Defendant makes statement to court why she has not been making payments. Ct. orders probation extended for 12 months from 11-19-2016.  Probation will now expire 11-19-2017.  If defendant pays $1,500 restitution then defendant can petition for termination from probation.
Probation review hearing on October 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
